alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:09PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Dewey. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leedey, Angora and Moorewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
